meanings.definition: To remove or reduce a magnetic field from (an object)
meanings.sent1: The technician degaussed the hard drive to erase all data.
meanings.sent2: The old cassette tape had to be degaussed before recording new music.
meanings.sent3: When the magician degaussed the metal spoon, it refused to stick to the magnet!
meanings.sent4: She felt like a degaussed compass, lost and without direction.
meanings.sent5: The scientist demonstrated how to degauss a magnet by using a simple experiment.

meanings.definition: To demagnetize (a magnetic tape or disk)
meanings.sent1: Before reusing the VHS tape, it needed to be degaussed.
meanings.sent2: The technician degaussed the floppy disk to ensure it was blank.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly degaussed all the tapes, causing chaos in the office!
meanings.sent4: His mind felt like a degaussed tape, memories fading away into nothingness.
meanings.sent5: The powerful magnet effectively degaussed the credit card, rendering it useless.
